1.text: I call to witness before God there fore, and the Lord Jesus Christ, being about to judge the living and the dead according to his appearance and his kingdom;

2.text: Proclaim the word; keep fixed seasonably, and unseasonably; refute, censure, beseech, in all longsuffering and teaching.

3.text: For the time will be when they will not hear sound doctrine; but according to their own eager desires they will heap up to themselves teachers, feeling itchings for a report;

4.text: And truly from the truth will they turn away the hearing, and be turned aside to fictions.

5.text: And thou be sober in all things, suffer ill treatment, do the work of the bearer of good news, render thy service perfectly certain.

6.text: For I am already poured out, and the time of my deliverance has been fixed.

7.text: I have contended earnestly the good contest, I have completed the course, I have kept the faith:

8.text: As to the rest, the crown of justice is laid up for me, which the Lord will assign to me in that day, the just judge: and not only to me, but also to all them having loved his appearance.

9.text: Be earnest to come to me quickly.

10.text: For Demas has forsaken me, having loved the time now, and has gone to Thessalonica; Crescens to Galatia, Titus to Dalmatia.

11.text: Luke alone is with me. Having taken Mark, bring with thyself: for he is useful for the service.

12.text: And Tychicus I sent to Ephesus.

13.text: The cloak which I left in Troas with Carpus, coming, bring, and the books, chiefly the parchments.

14.text: Alexander the coppersmith showed me much evil: (may the Lord give back to him according to his works:)

15.text: Whom watch thou also; for he greatly withstood our words.

16.text: In my first defence none was present with me, but all forsook me; (may it not be reckoned to them.)

17.text: But the Lord stood with me, and strengthened me; that by me the promulgation might be rendered perfectly certain, and all the nations might hear: and I was delivered out of the lionâ€™s mouth.

18.text: And the Lord will deliver me from every evil work, and save for his heavenly kingdom: to whom the glory for the times of times. Amen.

19.text: Greet Prisca and Aquila, and the house of Onesiphorus.

20.text: Erastus remained in Corinth: and Trophimus I left in Miletum sick.

21.text: Be earnest to come before winter Eubulus greets thee, and Pudens, and Linus, and Claudia, and all the brethren.

22.text: The Lord Jesus Christ with thy Spirit. Grace with you. Amen.
